Mukherjee Nagar clash: Police in capital.description: NEW DELHI: The Mukherjee Nagar incident has once again exposed how Delhi Police is ill at ease to deal with situations that require use of non-lethal force. Analysis of the video footage of the incident by senior officers has revealed that the basic protocols of policing were violated. Most of it is due to poor training. Delhi's Mukherjee Nagar clash: What followed after video went viralSome officers said the moment a plainclothesman had overpowered Sarabjeet Singh, others should have helped to handcuff him. That didn’t happen and Singh was not disarmed. 3 cops suspended after clash with tempo driver in Delhi's Mukherjee NagarAnyone familiar with American TV shows or Hollywood movies will know how police forces in the US tackle suspects: they are asked to put their hands behind their backs so that they can handcuffed, and the Miranda Rights are read out to them (where a policeman says, “You have the right to remain silent.”). If the suspect is violent, Tasers or stun guns are used to shock him into submission. Cops clash with mini-bus driver in north Delhi's Mukherjee NagarContrast this with the approach of Delhi Police and one realises that the learning curve is quite steep for the police force. The right kind of equipment is also not there with the police. Situations such as this require non-lethal riot gear. In 2015, Delhi Police had planned to procure Tasers. These are weapons that deliver electric shocks to disrupt the voluntary control of muscles. A few demonstrators had been procured as well, but nothing moved beyond that. A senior officer opined that Singh shouldn’t have been attacked with a pistol butt or sticks after he was pinned down. “The policemen should have used a vehicle to contain him and his son instead of carrying them by their limbs,” he added. Hitting someone with a pistol butt is also very risky as the gun could go off accidentally if it’s cocked. “Force is used to take a suspect into custody. Excessive use of force after capture is unprofessional. The way the policemen were trying to catch the suspect and beating him without disarming him shows that they are unequipped for close combat,” the officer said. Another retired officer said policemen these days often get carried away while countering attacks and involve themselves in fights instead of trying to control or subdue the subjects. On Sunday as well, the constables who had tried to restrain Singh and his son had started attacking them with a vengeance after they saw him hit a senior officer with a sword. “The objective was to pin him down and take him to the police station. Instead, they got busy hitting him which was unprofessional,” said another officer. The police were also slammed for carrying Singh away by his limbs. As per protocol, even if a suspect is restrained right outside the police station, it is imperative for the police to use a vehicle to contain him and drive him in. In Video:Mukherjee Nagar clash: Sikh community stage street protest, demands to sack Delhi cops who attacked auto driverDownload The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Delhi Assembly poll plan: BJP to hold se.description: NEW DELHI: The Bharatiya Janata Party is planning to conduct multiple surveys for better selection of political issues and candidates for the Delhi Assembly polls due early next year, senior party leaders said on Sunday. “BJP has been working on various fronts to ensure that it retains the 55% vote share it got in the capital in the LS polls for a comfortable victory in the state polls next year,” a senior Delhi BJP leader said. Regular meetings of the party are being held in view of the speculation that the Delhi Assembly polls may be pre-poned to coincide with the state elections in Maharashtra, Haryana and Jharkhand in October-November. “In view of the upcoming Delhi Assembly polls, three-phased surveys are planned for shortlisting constituency-specific issues, assessment of the AAP government (in Delhi) and the performance of its MLAs as well as to analyse the reach and popularity of our leaders for selecting suitable candidates,” a senior Delhi BJP leader said. In Video:Delhi Assembly poll: BJP to conduct surveys for better selection of candidatesDownload The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Tejasvi Surya.description: BENGALURU: From a boy who was groomed by late Union minister H N Ananth Kumar and Tejaswini Ananth Kumar to becoming the challenge to the family’s control over Bengaluru South segment, Tejasvi Surya has come a long way.While expressing his gratitude to Kumar and his family, Surya says he is a stark example of the BJP’s intent to infuse young and new blood. You were a surprise choice for Bengaluru South. Did you expect this development?While I had feelers that there was something like this going around, I was quite happily savouring pani puri with my friends. To be honest I was overwhelmed and started tweeting about this. I only feel gratitude towards the party, which is facing a crucial election and has decided to take risk by fielding a youngster in such a prestigious seat. At 28, will you be able to fill the shoes of Kumar?Filling the shoes of Ananth Kumar is a far fetched thing for he was so gigantic. I only pray to God to give me strength, sincerity and earnestness to honestly work for the people of this constituency so that one day in the eyes of the people I can match up to Kumar’s contribution to the constituency. On lack of political experience, I have a well oiled party organisational machinery to support me with senior leaders there to hand hold me. So what is this election going to be for you?Primarily it is an election for PM Narendra Modi’s aspirational India. It is about the promise of a new and young India and I am just an ambassador of the message of this new India. It is a reflection of party and Modi’s inclination of bringing in young blood. Tejaswini not getting the ticket is quite sensitive...Yes it is sensitive but even during her talk with the Karyakartas she told them that the it was time to show maturity. She has given her full support to me. But what is your personal opinion about Tejaswini missing the ticket?When her name was first finalised by the state leadership, it must be March 11, I was the first to extend my support to her and remember posting on social media that she was the most deserving candidate and a good choice from the constituency. But the party decided to field an ordinary karyakarta like me. It is a decision taken by big people and I am just a foot soldier obeying their diktat. I have always supported Tejaswini ma’am and was literally groomed by that family. I have no reason for acrimony. Statements by Karti Chidamabaram suggest that you are the Schutzstaffel of BJP, or the infamous SS of the Nazi Germany... Your tweets also suggest that your idealogical beliefs are in conflict with the “Sab Ka Saath Sab Ka Vikas” For Karti Chidambaram and others I will reply back to them in their own coin. The idealogical inclinations are not an issue for this election. The issue for the election today, is PM Modi’s promise of a new and superpower India. My only concern as on today is to ensure that Bangalore South elects the BJP with a massive margin so that we will strengthen Modi hands. Rest is immaterial. Is age an advantage or do you require time to project yourself as a leader?That the party leadership has reposed faith in me speaks for itself and the least minimum I can do is to live up to it and say I am capable enough as on today to take on these challenges. You must rise to the occasion and I will rise to it. On dynasty politics, considering you are a nephew of a sitting BJP MLA and PM Modi has gone on the offensive against the Congress on the issue of “Naamdar”...My candidature and my role and activity in politics has no connection to my uncle’s political life. I have an identity of my own and have worked very hard over years. My aspirations precedes his elections. If the party leadership thought I was a rise to another dynast, they would not have considered me at all. In Video:BJP announces 28-year-old Tejasvi Surya for Bengaluru South seatDownload The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Nine new vocational courses you can choo.description: NEW DELHI: Guru Gobind Singh Indraprastha University is going to begin the new academic session with nine new courses, including MSc yoga, PG diploma in yoga therapy and masters in vocational studies. The new undergraduate course being offered is BSc nursing. The state university has over 88,000 students studying in 120 colleges affiliated to it. The yoga therapy diploma is for medicos and para-medicos, with an inclusion of medical science and yoga. Most of the new courses are diplomas in interesting subjects such as cybercrime and law, security management and victimology and victim assistance. With the state government pushing for vocation courses, the varsity will also be offering masters of vocation in automobile, software development and interior design. The university will be conducting online counselling for 36 programmes, unlike 10 last year. While the varsity conducts common entrance tests, this year admissions to five courses will be done through national-level tests such as JEE (Main), Common Law Admission Test (CLAT), National Institute of Technology MCA Common Entrance Test (NIMCET) and Common Admission Test (CAT). Admissions in MBBS and BDS courses will be done through Medical Counseling Committee (MCC). Nitin Malik, joint registrar (admission), said, “The students registered with IP University applying for MBBS will also have to register with MCC.” Though the university is starting new courses, it may not increase the seats for the economically weaker sections (EWS). “The reservation is part of the central and state list both, so Delhi government is examining it,” said Ashutosh Mohan, vice-chancellor of the university. Mohan added that the helpline of the varsity will be revived and student volunteer will be roped in to address admission queries. Apart from the regular programmes, IP University also offers weekend programmes like MBA, LLM, MTech and MBA in disaster management. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP List 2019 Maharashtra.description: AURANGABAD/KOLHAPUR: Sitting MPs Sunil Gaikwad (Latur) and Dilip Gandhi (Ahmednagar) were denied tickets for the forthcoming Lok Sabha elections in the BJP’s first national list of candidates announced on Thursday. The list included 16 names from Maharashtra. While speculations were rife that the party would not retain Gaikwad owing to his differences with some senior BJP leaders, what came as a surprise was the ticket going to Sudhakar Shrungare, a member of the Latur zilla parishad. However, Shrungare, who is in the construction business, was the popular choice of local BJP workers. Gaikwad had won the 2014 election by a majority of over 2.5 lakh votes. Considered to be close to Union minister Nitin Gadkari, he was reportedly at loggerheads with Latur district guardian minister Sambhaji Patil-Nilangekar. The nomination of Sujay Vikhe Patil, son of senior Congress leader Radhakrishna Vikhe Patil, from Ahmednagar instead of Gandhi was a foregone conclusion ever since he joined the party last week. Sujay, a neurosurgeon by profession, will be making his entry into politics with this nomination. His late grandfather, Balasaheb Vikhe Patil, was long associated with the Congress. | Full coverage of Lok Sabha elections in MaharashtraAmong other prominent leaders from Maharashtra in the first list of candidates are Union minister Nitin Gadkari from his hometown Nagpur, state BJP chief Raosaheb Danve from Jalna, Union MoS Hansraj Ahir from Chandrapur and Union MoS for defence Subash Bhamre from Dhule. Late BJP MP Gopinath Munde’s daughter, Pritam, who was elected to Parliament with a record majority after her father’s death, has been renominated from Beed. Sitting MP from Sangli Sanjay Patil has also been renominated, putting an end to speculation over any change in constituency. Patil’s candidature was opposed by a section of BJP leaders in Sangli. However, chief minister Devendra Fadnavis is understood to have called a meeting of local party leaders and resolved the differences. The party has also given tickets to Heena Gavit from Nandurbar, Raksha Khadse from Raver, Poonam Mahajan from Mumbai North Central, Kapil Patil from Bhiwandi, Sanjay Dhotre from Akola, Ramdas Tadas from Wardha, Ashok Nete from Gadchiroli and Gopal Shetty from Mumbai North. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Maharashtra Lok Sabha Constituencies.description: MUMBAI: Maharashtra, which has 48 parliamentary constituencies, will go to polls in four phases, starting April 11. In 2009 and 2014, Lok Sabha elections were held in three phases in Maharashtra On April 11, seven constituencies in Maharashtra’s Vidarbha region will go to polls - Nagpur, Wardha, Yavatmal-Washim, and the naxal-affected areas of Gadchiroli and Chandrapur. In the second phase on April 18, 10 constituencies - including three constituencies in Vidarbha, six in Marathwada and Solapur in western Maharashtra - go to elections. The third phase, on April 23, of polling will be held in Pune, Baramati, Jalgaon, Jalna, Aurangabad, Raigad and Ratnagiri-Sindhudurg, Sangli, Satara and Kolhapur. In the final phase on April 29, all six constituencies in Mumbai, Thane, Kalyan, Palghar and Bhiwandi will go to polls among the total 17 seats in the state. KEY CONSTITUENCIESAmong the key constituencies are Baramati and Nagpur featuring high-profile candidates such as Supriya Sule and Nitin Gadkari. Then there is Ahmednagar from where Sujay Vikhe Patil, son of senior Congress leader Radhakrishna Vikhe Patil, is contesting. Other important constituencies are Jalna, Chandrapur, Dhule, Beed, Sangli, Mumbai North Central, Mumbai North and Baramati.    CONSTITUENCIES CONTENDERS   Chandrapur Union MoS Hansraj Ahir (BJP); Suresh Dhanorkar (Congress)   Baramati Kanchan Kul (BJP); Supriya Sule (Congress)   Jalna State BJP chief Raosaheb Danve BJP; Vilas Keshavrao Autade (Congress)   Akola Sanjay Dhotre (BJP); Hidayat Patel (Congress)   Bhiwandi Kapil Patil(BJP); Suresh Kashinath Taware (Congress)    Nagpur Union minister Nitin Gadkari (BJP)   Ahmednagar Sujay Vikhe Patil (BJP)   Dhule Union MoS for defence Subash Bhamre (BJP)    Beed Late BJP MP Gopinath Munde’s daughter Pritam (BJP); Bajrang Sonawane (NCP)   Sangli Sitting MP Sanjay Patil (BJP)    Mumbai North Central Poonam Mahajan (BJP)    Aurangabad Subhash Zambad (Congress)   Gadchiroli Ashok Nete (BJP)   Mumbai North Gopal Shetty (BJP)    Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Delhi: Man snatches phone to post videos.description: NEW DELHI: Six months ago, 20-year-old Jatin Nagar was introduced to TikTok by his friend. He initially liked watching funny videos posted by other users and soon the addiction prompted him to upload his own content. Nagar started gathering followers and six months down the line became a famous personality on the video-sharing app, which resulted in him earning money too. As his popularity grew, so did the demand to upload more content. Nagar, who works in the call centre of a popular restaurant, needed a new phone for this, but didn’t have the required funds. Instead of saving money, the youth came up with a trick. He searched for the phone he wanted on websites selling second-hand goods. He created a profile, chose a phone and contacted the seller. On June 12, the seller, Jatin Chhabra, came with his iPhone to meet Nagar at the mutually decided meeting point near Preet Vihar. However, instead of making the payment, Nagar snatched the phone from Chhabra and sped away on his motorcycle. A case was subsequently registered at Preet Vihar police station. DCP (east) Jasmeet Singh said that information about the snatching was relayed to all units. On Saturday, Nagar was spotted on Vikas Marg on his KTM bike, chased and nabbed by the cops. The snatched mobile phone was recovered from him. During interrogation, he told police that he was in need of an iPhone to make better videos, so he decided to snatch one. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Delhi tempo driver assault: Three cops s.description: NEW DELHI: An argument over a rashly driven 'Gramin Seva' tempo brushing against a police ERV in Mukherjee Nagar turned the area into a war zone on Sunday night. Cops have registered a cross FIR in the case and have handed it over to the crime branch for probe. Sources say that a case under sections of preventing a public servant from conducting his duty, attempt to murder and dangerous driving has been registered against the 'Gramin Seva' tempo driver while a case of assault has been registered against the cops. It all began when the driver of the vehicle pulled out a sword and started swinging it after he got into an argument with the policemen. Things turned ugly when he hit a cop with the sword. The driver and his teenage son, who had joined him, were caught by a dozen policemen, taken to the police station and thrashed. In the aftermath of the incident an ACP rank officer was dragged out by his collar and thrashed by a mob, a video of which went viral on social media. At least a dozen cops and people were also injured as the mob went on rampage, damaging cars and buses. Once the video of the incident went viral, a large crowd gathered outside the police station late at night and started protesting. Soon the protests turned violent and the mob dragged out policemen from the station and started attacking them. Cops are yet to register an FIR in the incident, but has suspended three policemen who were seen in the video using excessive force to contain the father-son duo. In Video:On cam: Sikh driver, his son beaten, dragged and kicked on road by Delhi PoliceDownload The Times of India News App for Latest City .

AP BJP List 2019.description: NEW DELHI: The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP), on Thursday, announced its first candidate list for the Lok Sabha elections 2019 that includes 184 candidates. The party has named two candidates from Andhra Pradesh in the first list. Kanna Lakshminarayana will contest from Narasaraopet Lok Sabha constituency while D Purandeshwari will contest from the Visakhapatnam seat. Andhra Pradesh will go to polls in a single phase on April 11. BJP's Lok Sabha first full list The Lok Sabha elections will be held in seven phases from April 11 to May 19, 2019. The counting of the votes has been scheduled for May 23. The first phase will be held on April 11, second on April 18, third on April 23 and fourth on April 29, fifth on May 6, sixth on May 12 and seventh phase on May 19. Prime Minister Narendra Modi will contest from Varanasi constituency, while BJP president Amit Shah will fight from Gandhinagar in place of L K Advani. As many as 90 crore electors, including 1.59 crore new voters aged 18-19 years, are registered to vote in the upcoming general election. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Delhi: Light rain with gusty winds expec.description: NEW DELHI: On Monday, a generally cloudy sky is expected along with dust storm or thunderstorm accompanied with light rain, gusty winds (speed 40-50 kmph) and lightning in city, predicts Met official. The morning temperature on Monday was normal for this time of the year. Track the pollution level in your cityLight rain on Sunday morning helped cool the city bringing down the maximum temperature below 40 degrees Celsius. The maximum temperature on Sunday was 36.3 degrees Celsius, three notches below normal, while the minimum was 28.2 degrees, normal for this time of the year. The humidity level oscillated between 28% and 75%. Palam had a maximum temperature of 37.8 degree Celsius, the highest in the city. This was a stark improvement from Saturday when the heatwave continued to scorch Delhi with a maximum temperature of 43.4 degrees Celsius, four notches above normal. At Palam, the mercury touched 45.4 degrees Celsius. Delhi had recorded its warmest day of the season last Monday, when Palam touched an all-time high of 48 degrees for the month of June. Safdurjung recorded a trace of rainfall till 8.30 in the morning, while till 5.30pm it was 0.6mm. The most rainfall of 2mm was recorded at Najafgarh till 5.30pm. According to the IMD bulletin for Sunday, the western disturbance as a cyclonic circulation lies over Jammu & Kashmir and adjoining Himachal Pradesh and is moving away eastwards. “Rain or thundershowers were observed at a few places over Haryana, Chandigarh and Delhi,” it added. “On Monday, a generally cloudy sky is expected along with dust storm or thunderstorm accompanied with light rain, gusty winds (speed 40-50 kmph) and lightning. The maximum and minimum temperatures will be 37 and 28 degrees Celsius, respectively,” a MeT official said. The weatherman has predicted possibility of rain till Thursday and the maximum temperature will slowly rise in the coming days. It is expected to touch 40 degrees again on Thursday. However, there is no prediction of heatwave till June 22. Delhi’s air quality, meanwhile, was in the “moderate” range with an Air Quality Index (AQI) of 178. SAFAR, an air forecasting agency under the Union ministry of earth sciences, said the AQI is predicted to slightly deteriorate for the next two days to reach the high end of moderate to poor category. “The region is characterised by high surface winds that can lead to significant local dust lifting. Under the influence of western disturbance, thunderstorms with gusty winds are expected for the next two days. This can lead to short-lived dust storms with sudden jump in PM10 concentrations. The AQI is predicted to slightly deteriorate for the next two days to high end of moderate to poor category. Later, it may improve due to mild showers,” the SAFAR report stated. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

JP Nadda.description: NEW DELHI: Ending speculation over the appointment of a working president, the BJP parliamentary board on Monday appointed former health minister and senior leader Jagat Prakash Nadda to the post even as home minister Amit Shah will continue to be party president. Nadda's appointment as working president was on the cards after he was not inducted into the government. Since Shah will need to meet his ministerial commitments, Nadda, as a full time party functionary, is expected to help him with the nitty-gritty of organisational tasks. "I am confident that under the leadership of Amit Shah and JP Nadda, and powered by the hard work of our karyakartas (workers), BJP will continue winning people's trust and serving our society. We remain committed to building a strong, developed and inclusive India," PM Modi tweeted. I am confident that under the leadership of Shri @AmitShah and Shri @JPNadda, and powered by the hardwork of our Ka… https://t.co/EyDidISB2W— Narendra Modi (@narendramodi) 1560786282000Modi said Nadda is a diligent worker who has risen through the ranks due to his hard work and organisational skills. "Humble and affable, he is widely respected across the BJP family. Congratulations to him on becoming the working president of the party," the Prime Minister added. Announcing the decision, defence minister Rajnath Singh said, "BJP won several elections under leadership of Amit Shah. But since PM appointed him home minister, Amit Shah himself said the responsibility of party president should be given to someone else. BJP Parliamentary board has selected JP Nadda as working president." Modi and other parliamentary board members including Shah, Rajnath Singh, Union ministers Nitin Gadkari, Thawar Chand Gehlot and senior BJP leaders Sushma Swaraj, Shivraj Singh Chauhan and Ramlal greeted Nadda after his selection as party working president. Hailing from Himachal, Nadda (58) has held several organisational posts at the national and state level. This will be the first time the party has appointed a working president. After considerable discussion it was decided that Shah's continuance would be required in view of important state elections coming up and the party also announced a membership drive and organisational elections that will keep cadre busy for several months. Singh said Nadda will remain the working president till BJP's membership drive and organisational elections are over. Process of the organisational elections has already begun as state unit elections are likely next month. As per procedure, it takes four-five months to complete the entire organisational elections. Singh said the parliamentary board wanted that Shah should look after the party as president until organisational elections of the party are completed. "However, Amit Shah himself urged that as home minister, he can't do justice with responsibilities as party chief and wanted someone to take over after which the parliamentary board unanimously selected Nadda as working president," Singh said. Nadda was mentioned as a likely party chief in 2014 when Rajnath Singh resigned after joining the Union ministry. However, Shah took over as party president. Nadda has long experience of the party organisation as he was the in-charge of the party headquarters and is a popular figure. In Video:JP Nadda elected as BJP Working President in DelhiDownload The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

\u2018Land issues hold up piped water to.description: NEW DELHI: Around 130 unauthorised colonies in the capital are not likely to get piped water supply anytime soon as work is stuck due to non-availability of no-objection certificates (NOCs) from landowning agencies, according to the Delhi Jal Board. DJB vice-chairman Dinesh Mohaniya said NOCs are not available for laying water pipelines in some unauthorised colonies, while it’s not feasible to undertake work in the rest. “Land-owning agencies give NOCs for laying water pipelines in any area. In these cases, they haven’t. For example, Archeological Survey of India may not give NOC for laying pipelines if an authorised colony comes up on its land,” he said. “Some unauthorised colonies have come up in such a haphazard manner that the first house is 10 feet away from the second and the second is 20 feet away from the third. Because of this, it’s not possible to lay water pipelines in such areas,” Mohaniya added. In the absence of piped water supply, residents of unauthorised colonies rely on DJB and private tankers, and illegal borewells. Officials said NOCs for most of the colonies are awaited from the forest department. According to an audit report of AAP government’s work done in 2018-19, NOCs are not available for 95 unauthorised colonies and work is not feasible in 36 others. There are a total of 1,725 unauthorised colonies in Delhi. People living there are believed to be the core vote bank of the AAP. As many as 1,230 unauthorised colonies got water pipelines by the end of 2017-18. DJB had set a target of laying water pipelines in another 291 unauthorised colonies in 2018-19. It, however, could complete work in only 144 such localities. Ahead of the Delhi assembly elections early next year, AAP dispensation has set a target of laying water pipelines in 151 unauthorised colonies. The Arvind Kejriwalled AAP government claims it gave piped water to 372 unauthorised colonies in last four years. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Nagpur BJP Candidate List.description: NAGPUR: After deadline for withdrawal for the first phase of Lok Sabha polls, 31 out of 147 candidates, whose nomination papers were found valid in seven constituencies of Vidarbha, have withdrew their papers. Now, 116 candidates are in the election fray, according chief electoral officer. Those remaining in the fray across seven constituencies are — Wardha – 14, Ramtek – 16, Nagpur – 30, Bhandara-Gondia – 14, Chandrapur – 13, Yavatmal-Washim – 24 and Gadchiroli-Chimur – 5. BJP leaders in Bhandara-Gondia are heaving a sigh of relief as two of the four rebels, Khushal Bopche and Prakash Malgave, have withdrawn from the fray after hours of persuasion by them. However, Rajendra Patle is still in the fray. Virendra Jaiswal, who resigned from BJP before nominations, is not being considered rebel as he contests every time. BJP’s Sunil Mendhe is pitted against Nana Panchbudhe of NCP here. Bopche’s rebellion had created panic in the BJP camp as he is popular in the Pawar community and in general among OBCs. In Nagpur, Abdul Karim Patel and Ravikant Meshram, withdrew on Thursday, taking the total number to three. Pallavi Nandeshwar had withdrawn on Wednesday. In Ramtek, Sachin Shende, Gajanan Jambhulkar, Prakash Tembhurne, Ranjit Saphelkar and Lalit Shamkuwar have opted out of the race. In Yavatmal-Washim and Wardha, seven and two candidates respectively withdrew on the final day. One independent candidate withdrew his nomination in Gadchiroli-Chimur constituency on Thursday. (With inputs from TO Abraham & Balwant Dhage) Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Narendra Modi.description: NEW DELHI: Urging the opposition to stop worrying about numbers, PM Modi on Monday said every word of the opposition was important and all efforts should be made for a " nishpaksh" (non-partisan) approach to issues of public welfare and the larger interest of India. His remarks at the start of the first session of the 17th Lok Sabha echo his announcement on Sunday of a meeting of leaders of all parties and an informal interaction of MPs, in what is seen as a bid to break the ice after a bitter poll campaign. "The opposition should stop worrying about numbers. The people have given them a certain number. Every word of the opposition is important. When it comes to Parliament, we should forget the ruling side and opposition. We should think of issues with a nishpaksh spirit," Modi said. The Prime Minister said an active and effective opposition is a necessity in a democracy and pointed out that a well- argued and factual criticism of the government strengthens democracy. "Sometimes such positive contributions are not noticed as they do not get high TRPs," he said. Though he did not mention the media, he said highlighting such efforts would strengthen the functioning of Parliament. Modi noted that the recent elections have yielded several firsts such as the highest number of voters exercising their franchise since Independence, a high number of women voters and a higher representation for women in Parliament. "It is also after several decades that a government has been re-elected with a bigger majority," he said. Referring to his recent speeches, the Prime Minister said that "we started with ' sab ka saath, sab ka vikas', but the people have added an unprecedented 'vishwas' (trust) to the matter". He said Monday marks the the start of the first session after the 2019 Lok Sabha polls. "I welcome all new MPs. With them comes new hope, new aspirations and new determination to serve," he said. In Video:Oppositions' every word is valuable: PM Narendra ModiDownload The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

How Delhi's Mukherjee Nagar turned into.description: NEW DELHI: A day after a video went around of a Gramin Sewa driver being dragged to the police station, beaten and kicked on his head by a group of cops, protesters from across the city gathered outside the Mukherjee Nagar police station on Monday evening. Mukherjee Nagar clash: Police in capital have neither training nor equipment to deal with violenceThey were responding to calls on social media from Sikh organisations. “Our main demand is that the policemen involved in the assault (on Singh) should be dismissed not suspended. Till now, only three have been suspended whereas the videos showed that at least 11 cops were involved in beating up the driver and his son,” said Sukhwinder Singh, who had come from Lajpat Nagar. Arvind Kejriwal leads demand for action against policemenPolice said the case has been transferred to the crime branch. “Joint commissioner (northern range) is also conducting a detailed fact-finding inquiry into the incident,” said Madhur Verma, Delhi Police spokesperson. CM Kejriwal too demanded action against the cops. “I appeal to the LG, DCP and the police commissioner that the policemen responsible for the attack be punished severely. No citizen should have to go through this at the hands of the police,” he said after meeting Singh. It all started on Sunday, when Singh’s vehicle brushed against police ERV (Emergency Response Vehicle), a Gypsy. When the ERV incharge, ASI Devender, confronted the man, he stepped out brandishing a sword. Singh said he was abused by the cops. Things turned ugly when the cops tried to disarm him. Singh said the cops had allegedly threatened him with a pistol, due to which he became agitated. “My son was in our vehicle and he too was threatened. I had reacted to this,” he said. “They were intimidating me with the pistol and sticks due to which I had pulled out the sword to defend myself and my son. I have identified and named a few policemen in my complaint,” Singh said. A video shows at least a dozen cops trying to pin the man down, while he tries to attack them with the sword. During this, ASI Yograj, who was in civil clothes, grabbed Singh from behind but he managed to free himself and attacked him with the weapon. Despite being injured, Yograj held on to the man. The other cops, meanwhile, kept hitting Singh with sticks while his 16-year-old son tried to free him from them. In the scuffle, Singh and his son were hit son several times with sticks and pistol butts. The cops also landed a few kicks on Singh’s head. Suddenly, his son is seen in the video driving the Gramin Sewa vehicle into the group of cops due to which two policemen got injured. ASI Yograj, whom Singh hit with a sword, claimed that the man instigated his son to attack the cops when they pinned him down. “I tried to grab him from behind as he started charging at other policemen. I managed to control his arms but his son came and started slapping me. Later, he tried to ram us with his vehicle. As my grip loosened, the man swung the sword at me. It hit my legs and then struck my head,” Yograj said. Some of the cops then got hold of the teenager and thrashed him, after which both Singh and his son were held by their hands and legs and carried to the police station, where they were detained. Meanwhile, the mobile phone video went viral on social media. Soon, a mob of around 400 men gathered outside the police station demanding Singh’s release. The protests turned violent around 10pm as the mob started smashing the glass panes of police and private vehicles parked outside the police station. When teams led by ACP Shalimar Bagh, K G Tyagi, and other senior officers tried to contain them, the mob turned its fury on the cops. At least a dozen vehicles were damaged. The ACP was cornered and thrashed by the mob. They finally dispersed when a contingent of riot control forces was deployed. Sarabjeet and his son were released later at night after a medical checkup. AAP holds meets to iron out wrinkles.description: NEW DELHI: Post the Lok Sabha poll debacle, Aam Aadmi Party has started a series of interactions with party workers across all 70 assembly constituencies to find out the weaknesses of the party before the capital plunges into assembly elections in February 2020. AAP could not win any of the seven parliamentary constituencies. It remained far behind Congress, while BJP won all seven seats by amassing a massive 56.5% vote share. Congress got 22.5% votes, while AAP managed to get only 18.1%. So far, 50 such meetings have taken place. A few of them have been chaired by Delhi convener Gopal Rai, MP Sanjay Singh, senior leaders Atishi Marlena, Raghav Chadha and Dilip Pandey. The focus is on figuring out the critical areas where the party needs to focus on to turn around the situation. AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal has asked party functionaries to work hard for the upcoming polls. A party functionary said senior leaders have been asked to address volunteer meetings in all assembly constituencies to strengthen the party’s position. Atishi, who has addressed meetings in Kondli, Vishwas Nagar and other assembly segments in east Delhi, said: “We are a volunteer-driven party and after every election we sit with our volunteers to understand the results. We have tried to identify our weaknesses and discussed how our performance can be improved in the assembly polls.” The party’s performance in the Lok Sabha polls was far below expectations. AAP was at third position in 48 of the 70 assembly constituencies. In a bid to assuage the concerns of party workers, AAP leaders emphasised that the party didn’t get much votes because it was a “big election” between Narendra Modi and Rahul Gandhi prompting people to vote accordingly. People will vote for AAP in the “small election” (assembly polls), they claimed. An AAP leader privy to the findings of the meetings claimed that the bad results in the parliamentary election have not taken a heavy toll on the enthusiasm of party workers. “The workers are not surprised by the outcome of Lok Sabha election. Functionaries at the assembly level shared that voters confided in them that they didn’t vote for AAP in LS polls because it was a different election,” the party leader added. He further claimed, quoting party functionaries, that during campaigning on the ground people told them, “Iss election mein maaf kar do, Dilli mein Kejriwal ko hi denge (Leave us during this election. For Delhi, we will vote for Kejriwal).” The meetings are also being used as platforms to know public grievances so that the party can focus on critical issues. The outcome of the meetings has been kept confidential. The senior leaders will put up the conclusions drawn from these meetings before CM Kejriwal. The findings will shape the course of AAP’s assembly election strategy. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Mamata Banerjee.description: VISAKHAPATNAM: Projecting TDP supremo and AP chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu as a “national leader of importance” and keeping the debate on the alternate front prospects in the ensuing elections alive, West Bengal chief minister and Trinamool Congress chief Mamata Banerjee appealed to people of AP to elect TDP again to keep the duo of Narendra Modi and Amit Shah away from power. “Who is Modi to ask about our Prime Minister candidate? We will decide who to elect our leader as there will be alternative for Modi,” she pointed out. Mamata said Naidu has done a lot for development of Andhra Pradesh. “It’s a necessity for AP people to give the power to Naidu again as he will play a key role in national politics and show a path of development to the entire country,” she added. Addressing a public meeting convened by TDP on Sunday, Mamata said Naidu is the leader to take the country forward. “Like he has done in Andhra Pradesh, Naidu can do a lot in Delhi,” she said. Coming down heavily on Modi, Mamata appealed the gathering to save the country and remove Modi (desh ko bachana hai to Modi ko hatao). “Modi claimed to be chaiwala after 2014 elections. Now he says he is chowkidar,” she added. “But chowkidar for whom? For those who looted the country. Modi had claimed that demonitisation would mitigate terrorism and stop black money, but ironically the number of terrorist attacks was the highest in the past two years. Under Modi’s regime, more number of farmers committed suicide and unemployment increased.” She added that Modi failed to explain the Pulawama incident and the Rafale deal and spurned the demand for an all-party meeting on the issues. “The nation does not want leaders like Narendra Modi and Amit Shah,” she asserted, and challenged Modi for an open debate on a national channel of his choice to discuss issues facing the country. BSP List 2019 UP.description: LUCKNOW: The BSP on Friday announced its first list of 11 candidates for the Lok Sabha elections 2019, fielding JD(S) turncoat Kunwar Danish Ali from Amroha. Ali, who was general secretary of the Janata Dal-Secular, quit the party and joined the Bahujan Samaj Party only last week. The BSP also declared Haji Fazulrahman its nominee from Saharanpur, Malook Nagar from Bijnore and Girish Chandra from Nagina, a party release said. Hazi Mohammad Yakoob has been fielded from Meerut, Satbeer Nagar from Gautam Buddh Nagar, Yogesh Verma from Bulandshahr, Ajit Baliyan from Aligarh, Manoj Kumar Soni from Agra, Rajveer Singh from Fatehpur Sikri and Ruchi Veera from Aonla. Mayawati's BSP is contesting 38 of the 80 Lok Sabha constituencies in Uttar Pradesh under the seat-sharing arrangement with Samajwadi Party and the Rashtriya Lok Dal. Delhi: Gang war averted with arms seizur.description: NEW DELHI: A gang war was probably averted in northeast Delhi after Delhi Police’s Special Cell arrested a gunrunner with a huge cache of arms, allegedly meant for some criminals associated with a gangster. He was found carrying 30 pistols and ammunition from a supplier in Madhya Pradesh’s Khargone. DCP (Special Cell) Sanjeev Yadav said Waisar, a resident of Khairana in UP, had been supplying weapons to Delhi’s criminals for the past three years. Following a tipoff, the team laid a trap on Ring Road near the ISBT on Monday, spotted Waisar with two big bags and found the arms and ammunition under packs of corn. While 13 automatic pistols of .32 bore along with 10 extra magazines and 25 live rounds of 315 bore were found in one bag, the other one had 17 countrymade pistols. “Waisar said he used to receive these consignments from a Khargone-based gunrunner and a supplier from Dhanbad,” said Yadav. He had got this consignment from one Intezaar, a resident of his village, who had procured it from Khargone. His first supplier, Musa, was arrested by the Special Cell in January. Waisar has also named a few of his associates. The accused had quit studies in Class VI after the death of his father, who was a farmer. While pursuing farming, Waisar came in contact with Musa, who lured him to join the illegal trade. After Musa’s arrest, Waisar started working as a carrier for Intezaar. No heatwave for next seven days in Delhi.description: NEW DELHI: Gusty winds and cloudy sky weather conditions are expected to continue for the next three-four days in city, says Met office. Another overcast, breezy day in the city brought relief from the sweltering heat. The maximum temperature on Monday was 33 degrees Celsius — six notches below normal, and the minimum was 28 degrees Celsius. Track the pollution level in your cityThe Meteorological (Met) office said gusty winds and cloudy sky brought the mercury down and kept the humidity levels between 45% and 65%. Moreover, traces of rainfall at isolated areas were an added bonus. On Thursday, however, the temperature might touch 40 degrees Celsius again, but the city is unlikely to witness heatwave conditions in the next seven days. “A western disturbance over Arabian Sea is causing these conditions. On Tuesday and Wednesday thunderstorm with light rain or lightning and dusty winds up to 30-40km per hour are expected,” a Met official said, adding that on Tuesday, the maximum temperature will be 31 degrees Celsius. Meanwhile, with an air quality index (AQI) at 123, the air quality in the city was in the ‘moderate’ range. SAFAR, an air forecasting agency under the ministry of earth sciences, said AQI is expected to improve slightly but remain in the moderate range for the next two days. Politicians seek action against cops who.description: NEW DELHI: Chief minister Arvind Kejriwal on Monday demanded strict punishment for police personnel involved in the brutal attack on a Gramin Seva tempo driver and his minor son in Mukherjee Nagar. The incident resulted into an uproar after the video clippings of the incident went viral on social media drawing reactions from Punjab CM Amarinder Singh, Delhi BJP chief Manoj Tiwari and several other politicians. Describing it as a shameful incident, the Punjab CM tweeted, "Shameful incident of Delhi Police ruthlessly beating up Sarabjeet Singh and Balwant Singh over a petty issue. Request home minister Amit Shah to ensure justice." Shameful incident of @DelhiPolice ruthlessly beating up Sarabjeet Singh & Balwant Singh over a petty issue. Request… https://t.co/wYzGanOCdT— Capt.Amarinder Singh (@capt_amarinder) 1560745478000Tiwari stated that there is no place for violence in a civilized society. "There should be an impartial inquiry into this incident and stern action should be taken against the persons found guilty but no action should be taken against the innocent persons," Tiwari said in a statement. Kejriwal visited the residence of Sarabjeet Singh and heard about the ordeal of the driver. "The manner in which the driver was beaten was most brutal and barbaric. I condemn this assault by Delhi Police personnel in the strongest possible words. I appeal to LG, DCP and the police commissioner that the policemen responsible for the attack be punished severely. No citizen should have to go through this at the hands of the police," Kejriwal stated. A delegation of Delhi Sikh Gurdwara Management Committee led by its president and BJP MLA Manjinder Singh Sirsa called upon police commissioner Amulya Patnaik to seek action against the cops. Sarbjeet Singh was also part of the delegation. "CP has assured that no guilty will be spared. An inquiry into the incident will be conducted by joint commissioner of police and the act of everyone involved in the incident will be identified," Sirsa stated. As the incident sparked protests on Sunday night, a group of AAP MLAs led by AAP Rajya Sabha MP Sanjay Singh also joined the protest outside the police station and termed the suspension of the three police personnel insufficient. Sirsa and officials of DSGMC were also among a large number of Sikhs who protested against the incident on Sunday night. Meanwhile, Kejriwal also tried to draw the attention of the LG and Union home minister towards the rising rate of crime in the city. “The LG and the home minister will have to be very strict about the rising rate of crime in Delhi. This needs to stop. What has happened is highly condemnable and those responsible should not be spared,” Kejriwal stated. Lok Sabha Poll 2019.description: LUCKNOW: With electioneering for the 2019 Lok Sabha polls gaining steam in Uttar Pradesh, political leaders are increasingly resorting to personal attacks on their adversaries. If the maverick BJP MLA from Bairia, Surendra Singh hit the headlines for his remarks against BSP supremo Mayawati, Uttar Pradesh cabinet minister Shrikant Sharma hit a new low by making indecent comments on Congress chief Rahul Gandhi. The Bairia MLA had said Mayawati gets facials done and her hair coloured even though she is 60-years-old. He also reportedly made offensive remarks against UPA chairperson Sonia Gandhi and Haryanvi singer-dancer Sapna Chaudhary, evoking widespread criticism from political parties and social media users. A media agency quoted him as saying that both Sonia Gandhi and Sapna Chaudhary used to work as dancers. "Rahul's mother (Sonia Gandhi) was also in the same profession in Italy and his father made her his own. He (Rahul Gandhi) should also take the family tradition forward and make Sapna his own," the MLA said. The BJP legislator, who is known for his controversial statements, had earlier termed Rahul Gandhi and his sister Priyanka Gandhi Vadra "Ravana and Shurpanakha", and accused Mayawati of "murdering" a woman's dignity by joining hands with one-time arch rival Samajwadi Party. UP Power Minister Shrikant Sharma stirred up a hornet's nest with his tweet terming the Congress president a "coward and impotent". The comments triggered a war of words between the two parties as well as on social media platform. Firebrand Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath also finds mention in the list of leaders accused of making personal remarks against political rivals. He recently termed Congress candidate from Saharanpur, Imran Masood, the son-in-law of Jaish-e-Mohammed chief Azhar Masood. Addressing a rally in Saharanpur on Sunday, Adityanath said, "The son-in-law of Azhar Masood has entered the constituency and he speaks the language of the terror mastermind. "You people have to ensure that the person who speaks the language of Azhar Masood is defeated in the Lok Sabha elections," he said while seeking votes for BJP candidate from Saharanpur, Raghav Lakhanpal. Union minister and BJP MP Mahesh Sharma referred to Rahul Gandhi as 'Pappu' and his sister Priyanka Gandhi as 'Pappu ki Pappi' during a poll campaign in Gautam Buddh Nagar. Rahul Gandhi has often been mocked by the BJP and his opposition as 'Pappu', a colloquial sneer. "Pappu kehta hai main prime minister banunga Mayawati, Akhilesh Yadav, Pappu.. aur ab 'Pappu ki Pappi' bhi aa gayi hai. Wo Priyanka kya pehle hamare desh ki beti nahi thi kya, Congress ki beti nahi thi kya, aage nahi rahegi kya? kya naya leke aayi hai?" the minister told a crowd of his supporters on March 16. The quotes loosely translate to "Pappu says he wants to become prime minister. Mayawati, Akhilesh Yadav, Pappu ... and now 'Pappu's Pappi' has also arrived. Wasn't Priyanka already a daughter of this nation, a daughter of the Congress? And would she not remain so in future? What new has she brought in?" Satta Matka 2018.description: AGRA: Shyam Vohra, known as 'satta king' of the Taj city, was denied bail by district court of Agra. Vohra, who was arrested by the Agra police in July for his alleged involvement in betting on FIFA World Cup matches. Earlier, in April, Vohra was arrested by the Nodia STF from Greater Noida for placing bets on IPL matches, but he was granted bail. After Vohra’s arrest, Agra police booked him and his known associates including his son Vatsal, wife Rakhi, nephew Prateek, brother-in-law Kaushal and others for their alleged involvement in betting. On Monday, judge Anil Kumar Pundhir rejected Vohra’s bail plea, who was charged for attempt to murder, as he allegedly opened fire on policemen. Further, Vohra was charged for running illegal gambling racket, criminal conspiracy and obstructing policemen from executing their duties. Police are yet to arrest the relatives and associates of Vohra. Several years back, Vohra had gain notoriety for betting on cricket matches. In April, during IPL matches, the gambling racket run by Vohra had deposited Rs 62 lakh in 10 banks, after which police approached banks to freeze the amount. Even during the FIFA World Cup, Vohra collected huge amount of cash through betting. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Pregnancy of minor rape victim terminate.description: NEW DELHI: The All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS) told the Delhi high court on Monday that it had terminated the over-22-week pregnancy of a minor rape victim as continuing with it would have had a severe impact on the girl's physical and mental health. It also told the court that the foetus had been preserved for DNA analysis in the rape case. The submission was made before Justice Najmi Waziri, who, thereafter, disposed of the plea moved on behalf of the rape victim seeking permission to medically terminate her pregnancy. The high court had, on June 14, asked the AIIMS to set up a medical board to examine whether it was necessary to end the pregnancy of the 14-year-old rape victim and to carry out the procedure expeditiously, if required. The court had also directed that a report be placed before it about the medical board's decision. It had also ordered preservation of the foetus for DNA analysis in the rape case. On Monday, advocate Aldanish Rein, appearing for the AIIMS, told the court about the decision taken by the hospital and submitted its report. According to the plea filed by advocates Anwesh Madhukar and Anshu Bhanot on behalf of the girl, on June 2, her mother came to know that she was pregnant and that she was raped. The same day, an FIR was lodged, the petition had said and added that an ultrasound test conducted on June 8 had revealed that the girl was pregnant for 22 weeks. Thereafter, the girl and her family approached the Child Welfare Commission for help and the panel advised her to seek permission from the court for medical termination of pregnancy (MTP). Under the Medical Termination of Pregnancy Act of 1971, a foetus cannot be aborted if the gestation period is more than 20 weeks. P Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .
